name: The Emma
description: Introducing The Emma; exuberant, irrepressible and bursting with life. It comprises pink oriental lilies, pink and white lisianthus and pale pink alstroemeria, statice, stallion and pitto.
instructions:
Introducing The Emma; exuberant, irrepressible and bursting with life.It comprises an Oriental pink lily, pale pink alstroemeria, lisianthus, statice, stallion and pitto.
Trim all your stems to the same length, at a 45 degree angle. Start by adding your varigated pitto leaves and the smaller statice and stallion flowers to create a full base. Now slot in your lisianthus and pale pink alstroemeria ensuring that each variety is evenly distributed throughout your arrangement. Position your pink lily at the front of your arrangement, for a beautiful focal point.

name: The Lucy
description: Add a touch of sophisticated winter sparkle to their Christmas with The Lucy. Inspired by the snowy forests of Narnia, this arrangement combines white bloom chrystanthemums, eryngium orion, fir and hypericum berries.
instructions:
The Lucy was designed by our florist and chosen for you. Inspired by the snowy forests of Narnia, the arrangement combines white bloom chrystanthemums, eryngium orion, hypericum berries and fur with a touch of winter sparkle.
Gather the fir, pine and eucalyptus to create a base for your arrangement. Intersperse the berries and eryngium throughout and place birch twigs around the edges of the foliage to add height. 
Finally, trim the white blooms to different lengths, and arrange in the centre of your bouquet for a stunning focal point.

name: The Beatrix
description: Velvety petals and festive fragrances combine with a hint of Christmas sparkle in this traditional Christmas arrangement, featuring burgundy carnations, rosemary, cinnamon and fir.
instructions:
The Beatrix was designed by our florist and chosen for you. Velvety petals and festive fragrances combine with a hint of Christmas sparkle in this traditional arrangement that features burgundy carnations, rosemary, cinnamon and fir.
Gather the fir, pine and rosemary to create a base for your arrangement. Keeping the bear grass tied together, insert this in the centre of the foliage. 
Intersperse the carnations, leucadenron and eryngium throughout. Finally, position the cinnamon and berries, and pull out individual strands of bear grass for movement and height.

name: The Viola
description: The Viola, a bouquet of deep purples and smoky greys, is inspired by Shakespeare's feistiest heroine. Bolero calla lilies and purple brassica, united with blue eryngium and pussy willow, create an irresistible display with a rock and roll edge.
instructions:
Introducing The Viola, a bouquet of deep purples and smoky greys, inspired by Shakespeare's feisty heroine. Bolero calla lilies and purple brassica, united with blue eryngium and pussy willow, create an irresistible display with a rock and roll edge.
Designed by our florist and arranged by hand for you, The Viola is ready to be displayed in your favourite vase. Just cut each stem diagonally about 3cm from the end, and re-trim every few days to enjoy your bouquet for as long as possible.

name: The Hester
description: Introducing The Hester, a stunning scarlet arrangement of Amaryllis, altitude roses and red hypericum. The addition of pussy willow and blue prince holly make this the ultimate Christmas arrangement.
instructions:
Introducing The Hester, a stunning scarlet arrangement of Amaryllis, altitude roses and red hypericum. 
The addition of pussy willow and blue prince holly make this the ultimate Christmas arrangement.
Designed by our florist and arranged by hand for you, The Hester is ready to be displayed in your favourite vase. 
Just cut each stem diagonally about 3cm from the end, and re-trim every few days to enjoy your bouquet for as long as possible.

name: The Scarlett
description: A riot of altitude roses, delicate hypericum berries and, dianthus green trix, The Scarlett is a dramatic tribute to the stunning Southern belle.
instructions:
A riot of altitude roses, delicate hypericum berries and, 'Green Trick' dianthus, The Scarlett is a dramatic tribute to the stunning Southern belle.
Designed by our florist and arranged by hand for you, The Scarlett is ready to be displayed in your favourite vase. Just cut each stem diagonally about 3cm from the end, and re-trim every few days to enjoy your bouquet for as long as possible.
